title: 2 Simple Ways to Upload and Share a Google Drive File

steps.title: Upload the file
steps.content: Upload the file to Google Drive. If you want to send and share a gallery of photos or a folder containing more than one file, create a new folder and then upload the files using the Google Drive mobile app. You can share individual files or folders with other users.

steps.title: Tap ⋮ next to the file or folder.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ next to the file or folder. This will be on the right side of the file or folder name. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . This will open the sharing screen.

steps.title: Add the person you want to share with.
steps.content: Add the person you want to share with. Use the Add people or groups field to enter a person's email address. As you type an email address, the matching contact will appear below the drop-down menu if they're in your Google Contacts . You can tap the contact name to add the rest of the email address.

steps.title: Select a sharing restriction level.
steps.content: Select a sharing restriction level. Tap the menu to select the level of access this person should have to the file or folder. Each person you share the file with can be an Editor (can edit the file or folder), Commenter (can add comments), or Viewer (can only see the file). You'll also find additional permissions to set by tapping the gear icon. If needed, you can now add more users or groups and set their permissions individually.

steps.title: Tap the "Send" arrow .
steps.content: Tap the "Send" arrow . It's the paper plane-shaped icon in the top-right side of the screen. This will send your file with your selected permissions to the specified recipient(s). You can also type a comment into the "Comments" box before sending the file to provide context to your recipient(s).

steps.title: Allow general access with a link (optional).
steps.content: Allow general access with a link (optional). If you need to share with a lot of people, you can provide general access to those who have the unique link. Keep in mind that you shouldn't share documents with sensitive information this way. Do the following: Tap ⋮ next to the file or folder. Tap Share . Tap ••• in the top-right corner. Tap Manage access . Tap Restricted twice. Select Anyone with the link . Tap Viewer and set a new sharing restriction if desired. Tap the link icon in the top-right corner. Paste or send the link.
